data.title: Hookha
data.text: Good service, hookah flavors are acceptable. Turkish coffee was horrible and tastes bad. Desert was ok the baklava was full of sugar syrup which cause me a heartburn.

data.title: We had breakfast and it was very delicious
data.text:
We had a great breakfast. We sat outside and our waiter was very gracious and made sure our coffee was always full.
Our eggs perfect and the plate was beautiful

data.title: Average Food
data.text: Had dinner at Morey's.  Mostly Mediterranean type food.  They have outdoor dining on patio.  It would be nice except that a big group of people sit out there with Hookahs smoking.  I don't want to eat around smokers.   Indoors is warm and dark.  I recommend lunch there because meals are good and prices are good.  Dinners run $12-20+.   Owner Morey serves your meals and is a very nice man.

data.title: Seems Half Hearted Attempt at a Restaurant
data.text: Been here twice and have never been impressed.  Sterile.  Food mediocre.  With other good restaurants coming to the area, this is well down on our list.

data.title: A Nice Restaurant in Search of an Identity
data.text: We miss Black Sheep Bistro and Nana Jean"; all in the same location as Morey's.  The biggest challenge for Morey's place is finding an identity or at least a nitch.  Experimentation has gone on (ranging from a South Seas cuisine to Mediterranean influenced servings).  Comfort hold overs like Nana Jean's pot roast and pot roast sandwiches remain popular.  Unfortunately the lake of theme or identity, makes it difficult to recommend this restaurant as a solid "4"; while the quality of the food may well deserve that rating.  The cost of dining at Morey's is definitely higher than Moderate, so that too influences where you might dine.  At the same price point, their are so many options within a mile radius of Morey's Place.  We keep coming back in periodically hoping that the restaurant has found it's way, as we want to see a successful restaurant in this Old Town Tustin location.  The Owner/operator is very nice and friendly.  The wait to dine is seldom long, but the food is enjoyable (if not memorable).

data.title: I don't get it.
data.text: I've only eaten breakfast here, and it was mediocre at best. The decor is mismatched and uninviting. Our server wasn't very familiar with the pretty standard menu. In such a wonderful location, I wish there was something more appealing with warmer decor and a more thoughtful menu.

data.title: Great food and warm hospitality.
data.text: It was a nice surprise to find this place on a quite Tustin street. Warm and homy atmosphere and a great food, if giving a short description. Definitely would come back when in So Cal again.

data.title: Delicious Mediterranean/Persian Lunch Buffet
data.text: My wife and I tried Morey's because we love Mediterranean food and their (new) banner announced an all you can eat buffet. We were delighted. Excellent salad fixings, soup of the day, kebabs, fish and lamb offerings. The Persian rice and other vegetable offerings were very tasty. Sam, the (new?) manager was personable, caring and prompt with service. Sitting outside was very comfortable. We are going to add this restaurant to our rotation! Note: ask for pita bread if you want it.

data.title: Great food
data.text: 3rd time I come here and flavor is very authentic, service sometimes is bad but flavor makes me forget it. Also beer is not old like many other places

data.title: First timer
data.text:
rey was our first time. We had saw the sign for the breakfast special. We were pleased. The food was excellent and high quality. We will definitely come back the prices are also reasonable. I will definitely tell my family and friends about
 Moreys place

s plae.

data.title: Cool place, cool people
data.text:
Ultra-cool and friendly place. I'll be coming here every Thursday night for the open mic and stand-up comedy show. This place has some of the finest local food, wine and beer available. Matt, the guy who runs the open mic says some of his favorite menu items are the Short Rib Nachos, Gyro, Mac and Cheese and Filet Mignon Skewers, but in my humble opinion, everything is delicious.

Like I said, they have a great open mic every Thursday night at 7 with great poets, musicians, artists and of course, some of the best up and coming standup comedians in Southern CA.

data.title: Delicious and Inexpensive
data.text:
My aunt ( a 35 year Tustin resident) and I decided to try Morey's for lunch for the first time this past Wednesday. We arrived around eleven-thirty and Morey's was empty, but it filled by the time we were finished eating.

The staff was really nice, both friendly and helpful with suggestions. My only complaint is they did not come by to check on us or refill our drinks. We thought that they may have been short staffed once the restaurant filled up, because they were so great early on in our meal.

My aunt ordered off of the breakfast menu, having eggs. She is not a big eater and she cleaned her plate, throughly enjoying her meal. It is very unusual for her to eat everything!

I had a club sandwich with potato salad on the side. The sandwich was massive...like they used extra big slices of bread. The ingredients were high quality and the sandwich was really fantastic. I enjoyed the potato salad, but would likely try a different side dish in the future.

The prices are very reasonable. We were actually surprised at how low the bill was, about fifteen dollars for two meals and two drinks. Not bad at all.

This will definitely become a regular breakfast/lunch spot for us and we are so happy to have branched out of our normal roster of restaurants to try it.

Please check out my blog for more reviews and local happenings.

data.title: Great little place in old town tustin
data.text: Stopped by while visiting the area for lunch,friendly family owned with very tasty sandwichs and salads. Would be a regular if we lived closer!!
